amendment.description: To protect Second Amendment rights, ensure that all individuals who should be prohibited from buying a firearm are listed in the National Instant Criminal Background Check System, and provide a responsible and consistent background check process.

action.text: Motion by Senator Reid to reconsider the vote by which amendment SA 715 (Record Vote No. 97) was not agreed to entered in Senate.

vote.text: Amendment SA 715, under the order of 4/16/13, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 97.

action.text: Amendment SA 715 proposed by Senator Manchin.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 715, under the order of 4/16/13, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 97.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 715, under the order of 4/16/13, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 97.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 715 proposed by Senator Manchin.
